      • query

        public CloseableIterable<T> query(String key,
                         Object query)
                                                 throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Description copied from interface: Index
        Get all the elements that are indexed by the provided key and specified query object. This is useful for graph implementations that support complex query capabilities. If querying is not supported, simply throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Specified by:
        query in interface Index<T extends OrientElement>
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the indexed elements
        query - the query object for the indexed elements' keys
        Returns:
        an iterable of elements that have a particular key/value in the index that match the query object
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException

        Description copied from interface: Index
        Get a count of elements with a particular key/value pair. The semantics are the same as the get method.
        Specified by:
        count in interface Index<T extends OrientElement>
        Parameters:
        key - denoting the sub-index to search
        value - the value to search for
        Returns:
        the collection of elements that meet that criteria
